category.name: Networking
category.description: Parameters which affect the DigiMesh network

setting.name: Channel
setting.description: Set/read the operating channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers) Only modules with a matching CH can communicate with each other

setting.name: Network ID
setting.description: The network ID Only modules with a matching ID can communicate with each other

setting.name: Device Role
setting.description: The routing and messaging mode of the module. A routing module will repeat broadcasts. Indirect Messaging Coordinators will not transmit point-to-multipoint unicasts until they are requested by an end device. Indirect messaging is only available on point-to-point transmissions (TO=0x40). Setting a radio as a poller will cause it to regularly send polls to its Indirect Messaging Coordinator (defined by DH and DL). Non-Routing nodes will not route multi-hop packets.

setting.name: Compatibility Options
setting.description: Set/read compatibility options: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Reserved Bit 1 - Reserved Bit 2 - Set to enable 128-bit AES Encryption when EE=1, clear for 256-bit AES All other bits must be set to 0

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: A human-friendly node identifier string for this module. This can be up to 20 ASCII characters. This value is returned in a ND query and can be used to easily identify modules.

setting.name: Network Discovery Back-off
setting.description: The network discovery back-off parameter. This sets the maximum value for the random delay used for network discovery responses to be sent (Used for ND, DN, and FN commands).

setting.name: Network Discovery Options
setting.description: Bitfield of network discovery options for this module Options include: Bit 0 - Append DD value to end of network discovery Bit 1 - Return devices own ND response first Bit 2 - Include RSSI information in response

setting.name: Maximum Packet Payload Length
setting.description: The maximum number of payload bytes that can be sent in a RF transmission

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Unicast Retries
setting.description: The maximum number of MAC RF packet delivery attempts of unicasts. If RR is non-zero then packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Broadcast Multi-Transmits
setting.description: The number of additional broadcast retransmissions. All broadcast packets are transmitted MT+1 times to ensure it is received.

setting.name: Transmit Options
setting.description: The module's transmit options. These options are used for all transmissions (API transmissions can override this using the TxOptions field of the API frame). Options include: Bit 0 - Disable ACK Bit 1 - Disable Route Discovery Bit 2 - Enable NACK Bit 3 - Enable Trace Route Bits 6,7 - Delivery Method: b'00 = Invalid Option b'01 = Point to Point/Multipoint (0x40) b'10 = Repeater/Directed-Broadcast (0x80) b'11 = DigiMesh (0xC0) See the product manual for further details on this command.

setting.name: Cluster ID
setting.description: The default cluster identifier value used for serial data transmissions. If this value is set to 0x12 then the destination will echo any transmitted packet back to this module. The default value is 0x11.

category.name: DigiMesh Configuration
category.description: Parameters which affect outgoing transmissions in a DigiMesh network

setting.name: Mesh Unicast Retries
setting.description: The maximum number of network packet delivery attempts. If MR is non-zero, packets sent will request a network acknowledgement, and can be resent up to MR times if no acknowledgements are received. Changing this value will dramatically change how long a route request takes. We recommend this value be 1.

setting.name: Broadcast Hops
setting.description: The maximum transmission hops for broadcast data transmissions. Set the value to 0 for maximum hops. If BH is set greater than NH then the value of NH is used.

setting.name: Network Hops
setting.description: The maximum number of hops across the network. This number limits the number of hops and it is used to calculate maximum network traversal time. This value must be set to the same value on all nodes in the network.

setting.name: Network Delay Slots
setting.description: The maximum number of delay slots before rebroadcasting a network packet.

setting.name: DigiMesh Diagnostic Options
setting.description: Bitfield of DigiMesh-specific options which can be disabled. Options include: Bit 0 - Disable aggregator update. When enabled the module will neither issue nor respond to ATAG requests. Bit 1 - Disable Trace Route and NACK responses. When enabled the module will neither generate nor respond to Trace Route or NACK requests.

setting.name: MAC Unicast One Hop Time
setting.description: The MAC unicast one hop time timeout in milliseconds.

setting.name: MAC Broadcast One Hop Time
setting.description: The MAC broadcast one hop time timeout in milliseconds.

setting.name: Network Discovery Timeout
setting.description: The maximum response time, in milliseconds, for network discovery (ATND) responses and discover node (ATDN) responses. The timeout is based on the network discovery back-off time (ATNT) and the network propagation time.

setting.name: AES Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable 128-bit or 256 bit AES encryption depending on ATC8 option.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: The Link Key used for encryption and decryption. If ATC8 bit 2 is cleared, encryption/decryption uses the 256 bits of the KY value (All 64 ASCII chars of the KY value). ATC8 bit 2 is set encryption/decryption uses the last 32 ASCII chars of the 256 bit KY value entered. This parameter cannot be read.

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: The transmitter output power level.

setting.name: Output power in dBm
setting.description: Read the output power in dBm. Negative values will be represented in two's compliment.

setting.name: CCA Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the Clear Channel Assessment (CCA) threshold. If the modem detects energy above the CCA Threshold, it will not transmit. The CCA parameter is measured in units of -dBm. Setting the parameter to 0x00 will disable CCA, otherwise the valid range is 0x28-0x64.

setting.name: Last Packet RSSI
setting.description: The RSSI of the last received packet in -dB. The received signal strength indication (RSSI) is acquired when a packet is being received by this module. In a mesh network the RSSI of the last hop is reported.

setting.name: MAC ACK Failure Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions that timed out awaiting a MAC ACK (Can be up to RR+1 timeouts per unicast when RR>0).

setting.name: CCA Failure Count
setting.description: The number of transmissions that failed to transmit due to energy detected above the CCA threshold or due to detecting an RX in progress.

setting.name: Bytes Transmitted
setting.description: The number of RF bytes transmitted. Every byte of every packet is counted, including MAC/PHY headers and trailers.

setting.name: Good Packets Received
setting.description: The number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: Transmission Failure Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions where retries expired with no ACK received (when RR>0).

setting.name: Unicasts Attempted Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions expecting an acknowledgement (when RR>0).

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Set/read sleep mode. Pin sleep requires D8 and/or P7 to be set to 1 to invoke sleep. Asynchronous cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and briefly wakes, checking for activity.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: The sleep time of the module.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: The wake time of the module. Maximum value is an hour (or 0x36ee80 ms).

setting.name: Number of Cycles Between ON_SLEEP
setting.description: The number of cyclic sleep cycles between assertions of the On/Sleep pin. This allows external circuitry to sleep longer than the SP time. Set to 1 to set On/Sleep high after each SP time (default). (Example: if SN=3, the On/Sleep line will assert only every third wakeup; SN=9, every 9th wakeup; etc.)

setting.name: Wake Host Delay
setting.description: The time the module will delay before sending serial data out the UART or taking IO samples after waking from sleep. This can be used to give a sleeping host processor sufficient time to power up after the module asserts the ON_SLEEP line.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Advanced sleep options Bitfield map: Bit 8 - Always wake for the full ST period All other option bits should be set to 0.

setting.name: UART Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between the serial port of the module and the host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window and then read the BD parameter to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: UART Parity
setting.description: The parity for the UART.

setting.name: UART Stop Bits
setting.description: Configure the number of stop bits that the UART will output.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: The flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: Transparent Packetization Timeout
setting.description: The number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the serial port. When API is enabled the serial data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: API Output Mode
setting.description: The API data frame type output format for received API frames.

setting.name: Extended API Options
setting.description: Set the extended API options. This controls whether or not ZCL packets should be routed to the serial port.

category.name: AT Command Options
category.description: Change AT Command Mode Behavior. Command mode is only accessible via the UART.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard time to enter command mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: The required period of silence before, after, and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

category.name: UART pin configuration
category.description: Pin configuration for the UART interface

setting.name: DIO6/RTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6/RTS line of the module. TH pin 16 Options include: RTS flow control Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO7/CTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7/CTS line of the module. TH pin 12 Options include: CTS flow control Digital input Digital output RS-485 control

setting.name: DIO13/UART_DOUT Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO13 line of the module. TH pin 2 Options include: UART DOUT Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO14/UART_DIN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO14/UART_DIN line of the module. TH pin 3 Options include: UART DIN Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO0/AD0/Commissioning Button Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0/Commissioning line of the module. TH Pin 20 Options include: Commissioning button ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO0/AD1/SPI_nATTN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1/SPI_nATTN line of the module. TH pin 19 Options include: SPI_nATTN on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO2/AD2/SPI_CLK Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2/SPI_CLK line of the module. TH pin 18 Options include: SPI_CLK on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO3/AD3/SPI_nSSEL Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. TH pin 17 Options include: SPI_nSSEL on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO4/SPI_MOSI Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO4/SPI_MOSI line of the module. TH pin 11 Options include: SPI_MOSI on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO5/Association LED Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc line of the module. TH pin 15 Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO8/DTR/Sleep_Rq Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO8 line of the module. TH pin 9 Options include: Sleep Request/DTR (used with pin hibernate and pin wake) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO9/Sleep Indicator Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO9 line of the module. TH pin 13 Options include: Awake/nSleep indicator (pin is LOW when module is asleep) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO10/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10/PWM0 line of the module. M0 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 6 Options include: RSSI PWM output PWM output Digital Input and Output

setting.name: DIO11 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11/PWM1 line of the module. M1 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 7 Options include: PWM output Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO12/SPI_MISO Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12/SPI_MISO line of the module. TH pin 4 Options include: SPI_MISO on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: Pull-up Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pullup resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pullup enabled, 0=no internal pullup. Bitfield map: Bit0 - DIO4 | TH Pin 11 Bit1 - DIO3 | TH Pin 17 Bit2 - DIO2 | TH Pin 18 Bit3 - DIO1 | TH Pin 19 Bit4 - DIO0 | TH Pin 20 Bit5 - DIO6 | TH Pin 16 Bit6 - DIO8 | TH Pin 9 Bit7 - DIO14 | TH Pin 3 Bit8 - DIO5 | TH Pin 15 Bit9 - DIO9 | TH Pin 13 Bit10 - DIO12 | TH Pin 4 Bit11 - DIO10 | TH Pin 6 Bit12 - DIO11 | TH Pin 7 Bit13 - DIO7 | TH Pin 12 Bit14 - DIO13 | TH Pin 2

setting.name: Pull-up/down Direction
setting.description: Set/read bitfield for resistor direction (1=pullup, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM0 Duty cyle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M0=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM1 Duty cyle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M1=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: RSSI PWM timeout register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI PWM pin (P0). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet or APS acknowledgment and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: The Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: IO Sampling Rate
setting.description: Set the IO sampling rate to enable periodic sampling. If set >0, all enabled digital IO and analog inputs will be sampled and transmitted every IR milliseconds. IO Samples are transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

setting.name: Digital IO Change Detection
setting.description: Bitfield that configures which digital input pins should be monitored for change detection. If a change is detected on an enabled digital input pin, a digital IO sample is immediately transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL. Bitfield map: Bit0 - DIO0 Bit1 - DIO1 Bit2 - DIO2 Bit3 - DIO3 Bit4 - DIO4 Bit5 - DIO5 Bit6 - DIO6 Bit7 - DIO7 Bit8 - DIO8 Bit9 - DIO9 Bit10 - DIO10 Bit11 - DIO11 Bit12 - DIO12 Bit13 - DIO13 Bit14 - DIO14

setting.name: Analog Voltage Reference
setting.description: The analog voltage reference used for A/D sampling.

setting.name: Sleep Sample Rate
setting.description: Set or read the number of sleep cycles that must elapse between periodic I/O samples.

setting.name: I/O Input Address
setting.description: The source address of the device to which outputs are bound. To disable I/O line passing, set all bytes to 0xFF. To allow any I/O packet addressed to this device (including broadcasts) to change the outputs, set IA to 0xFFFF.

setting.name: Enable Serial Output For I/O Line Passing
setting.description: When I/O line passing is enabled, optionally suppress serial output if source address matches IA or if IA is set to 0xFFFF. 0=Suppress output, 1=Allow output

setting.name: D0 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D1 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D2 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D3 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D4 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D5 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D6 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D7 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D8 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D9 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P0 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P1 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P2 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: PWM Output Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long both PWM outputs (P0, P1) output a given PWM signal before it reverts to the configured value (M0/M1). If set to 0, there is no timeout. This timeout only affects these pins when they are configured as PWM output.

category.name: Diagnostics - Firmware/Hardware Information
category.description: Information about the XBee hardware and firmware

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: The module firmware version number.

setting.name: Bootloader Version
setting.description: Display the Bootloader version

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: The module hardware version number.

setting.name: Hardware/Firmware Compatability
setting.description: Specifies what firmware is compatabile with this radio. Firmware with a compatibility value lower than the value returned by %C cannot be loaded onto the board.

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: Read the supply voltage of the module in mV units.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: Read power compensation temperature sensor in units of Celsius degrees.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: The Digi device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Configuration CRC
setting.description: The CRC of the current settings. The purpose of this command is to allow the detection of an unexpected configuration change on a device. After a firmware update this command may return a different value.
